result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Arveon Z Brown

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Arveon Z Brown appeared by video.  Attorney Arial Jade Rosenberg in court for Arveon Z Brown.  Prosecuting attorney Thomas Hasle in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: MPD Detective M. Martin.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 11.
Scheduling conference scheduled for November 11, 2022 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint PreTrial Services Supervision Report dated October 3, 2022; received and filed.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3. Court ordered Defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY. Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription. No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with :
Community Financial Service Centers
Karl Tatum
Lillian A H
Maria M B

Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Swanson, Branch 11.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.

Defendant Arveon Z Brown in court, in custody.  Attorney Arial Jade Rosenberg in court for Arveon Z Brown.  Attorney Patrick J Anderson in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Doctor's report received and filed.  Parties reviewed report and do not contest findings.  Court found defendant competent to proceed and reinstated proceedings. Initial appearance proceeded.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 4, 2022 at 08:30 am.
No Contact Order signed and filed.
Report dated 08-31-2022, filed.

Attorney Arial Jade Rosenberg in court, defendant Arveon Z Brown not in court, in custody.  Patrick J Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case in court for Doctor's report return. Defense requests adjournment.  Defendant has been receiving treatment in the jail and is awaiting transport to Mendota. Court grants defenses request. Doctor's Report Return scheduled for September 14, 2022 at 08:30 am.  All parties are notified that effective July 30, 2022 this case will be assigned to Judge David Swanson, Branch 11, in Room 608 of the Courthouse.

Order of Commitment for Treatment (Incompetency)

records.descr: DE not competent to stand trial, case suspended

records.addlTxt: Order of Commitment for Treatment (Incompetency)

Defendant Arveon Z Brown in court with attorney Arial Jade Rosenberg.  Defendant Arveon Z Brown in custody.  Patrick J Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. BRANCH 04 FOR BRANCH 28. 

Competency Hearing proceeded.  State does not challenge Dr. Niess report.  Defense does challenge Dr. Niess report.  Parties stipulated that Dr. Niess is qualified to testify as an expert. Sworn for the State: Dr. Niess. Court takes notice of the report and its narrative text. No objection from Defense. Evidence closed. Arguments heard. Court finds Dr. Niess is a credible expert and performed a proper examination. After review of all evidence, report of Dr. Niess, and testimony of Dr. Niess, Court finds defendant incompetent to proceed at this time but is likely to become competent. Court ordered defendant commitment for treatment for incompetency.  Order of Commitment for Treatment (Incompetency) signed and filed.  The sheriff shall arrange for transportation of the defendant to the treatment facility. Court orders that Defendant be transported FORTHWITH. Court ordered case adjourned in Branch 28.  Doctor's Report Return scheduled for July 14, 2022 at 10:30 am.
received and filed.
Competency hearing scheduled for May 4, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Arveon Z Brown in court with Attorney William Hotchkiss.  Defendant Arveon Z Brown in custody.  Dennis Patrick Murphy, appearing for Patrick Anderson, appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  All parties appear in person.
Parties in court to review the doctor's report with the court.

State is not challenging the findings of the doctor's report.
Defense counsel advises the Court that the defendant is challenging the findings of the doctor's report.

Court orders case adjourned for competency hearing in Branch 28.

Forensics contacted during the hearing and confirmed Dr. Niess for the next court date.

Clerk:  jms
from Jenna Niess, Psy.D., dated March 31, 2022 - received
The Judge's explanation is outlined on the submitted order.  Competency raised.

Defendant Arveon Z Brown in court with attorney Kylie Kaltenberg.  Defendant Arveon Z Brown in custody.  Anna Marie Meulbroek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   All parties appeared by video conference.
   Court is advised by the defense there is reason to believe the defendant is not competent to proceed.  Pursuant to Sec. 971.14 (2) Wisconsin Statutes, Court found probable cause and ordered defendant examined by the Forensic Unit.  Order for Examination, signed and filed.   Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Sanders, Branch 28.   Court ordered defendant REMANDED into custody of Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.  Doctor's Report Return scheduled for April 4, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
